intro: Indoschulzia garhwalica, commonly known as the Garhwal Schulzia, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
